p: Compared to patients with FluB-p, FluA-p patients were younger and predominantly male. In FluA-p patients, cerebrovascular disease, diabetes mellitus and smoking history were frequent, whilst cardiovascular disease was less common. FluA-p patients more frequently showed axillary temperatures ≥ 38 °C, confusion, arterial hydrogen ion index (pH) < 7.35, PO 2/FiO 2 < 300 mmHg and multilobar infiltrates compared to FluB-p patients. More FluA-p patients had coinfections (Table 1).
